operation: tonsillectomy, uvulopalatopharyngoplasty, and septoplasty.

operation: tonsillectomy, uvulopalatopharyngoplasty, and septoplasty.
anesthesia: general anesthetics.
the patient was unable to tolerate treatment with cpap.
afrin drops were placed in both nostrils and a cottonoid soaked with afrin was placed in each side of the nose.
afrin drops were placed in both nostrils and a cottonoid soaked with afrin was placed in each side of the nose.
a crowe-davis mouth gag was placed.
the tonsils were first removed using electrodissection technique.
hemostasis was achieved with the electrocautery and with sutures of 0 plain catgut.

hemostasis was achieved with the electrocautery and with sutures of 0 plain catgut.
the tonsil fossae were injected with 0.25% marcaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine.

the planned anterior soft palate incision was marked out with the electrocautery from the left anterior tonsillar pillar rising upwards and then extending horizontally across the soft palate to include all of the uvula and a portion of the soft palate, and the incision then extended across the midline and then inferiorly to meet the right anterior tonsillar pillar.
a #15 blade was used to make a left cheilion incision.
mucoperichondrium and mucoperiosteum were elevated with the cottle elevator.

text: deflected portion of the septal bone resection
context: with takahashi forceps and with the 4 mm osteotome, the deflected portion of the septal bone from the vomer was resected.
the nasal septal mucosal flaps were then sutured together with a quilting suture of 4-0 plain catgut.
the inferior turbinates were then both outfractured using a knife handle, and now there was a much more patent nasal airway on both sides.
polysporin ointment was introduced into both nostrils.
estimated blood loss was about 15-20 cc.
